required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Impact on Humoral Sensitization of SANGUINATE in Patients With End Stage Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib, Open-Label, Single Arm Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Impact on Humoral Sensitization of SANGUINATE Infusion in Patients With End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase Ib, Open-Label, Single Arm Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Impact on Humoral Sensitization of SANGUINATE Infusion in Patients with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD).

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to investigate the safety of SANGUINATE on humoral sensitization in End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) patients receiving dialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of study treatment as determined by changes in vital signs, electrocardiographic assessments, clinical signs, and bio-analytical measures (e.g., blood chemistry, hematology), and reported adverse events following infusion
primary_outcome.description: Composite endpoint with multiple vital signs, ECGs, clinical assessments and bio-analytical lab measurements over the 90 day time frame.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the number of HLA-Antibody specificities determined by single antigen bead assays
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody testing Human leukocyte antigen- antibody (HLA-Ab) HLA Tissue Typing (screening visit only) Calculated Panel Reactive Antibody (CPRA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the overall strength of HLA-Antibody specificities determined by single antigen bead assays
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody testing Human leukocyte antigen- antibody (HLA-Ab) HLA Tissue Typing (screening visit only) Calculated Panel Reactive Antibody (CPRA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in the calculated panel reactive antibody (CPRA)
Percent of patients with an increase in number of HLA-Ab specificities determined by single antigen bead assays
Percent of patients with an increase in CPRA
Pharmacokinetic profile as determined from blood plasma over time (Tmax, Cmax, AUC, half-life, coefficient of variation, and the apparent elimination rate constant)
Percent of patients with an increase in the overall strength of HLA-Antibodies

overall_official.affiliation: University of Cincinnati/ Division of Nephrology

facility.name: University of Cincinnati/ Division of Nephrology
